course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Data Science for Biology and Medicine
course.description: This is a course for the application of data science in biology and medicine. The course will introduce the fundamental principles on data science, the technologies and implementations of data mining, as well as the modeling of several practical questions in biomedicine. The topics include introduction to biomedical data, data visualization, regression methods and classification methods.
course.prerequisites: (COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022P OR COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21) OR COMP 2011) AND (ISOM 2500 OR LIFS 3150 OR MATH 2411) AND (LIFS 3140)

reviews.author: niwakkoki
reviews.title: Great course to learn data science in biology and medicine
reviews.comment_content: The contents are very, very rich, which cover a lot of thoughts & algorithms in data science/statistic/math in addition to the biology and the medicine. From the DNA sequencing to the application of the biological network. The individual projects as well as the finial exam are included in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is like step-by-step teaching with the back ground of the  basic in bioinformatics and computational biology. Very clear
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is pretty great for me to adopt my workload. If you can finish all the projects on time, the grade will statistify yourself. For me, it is a good grading for the review/Q&A section in the course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine for me. In this semester, there are 3 projects, each of which has ~one month to command. For the finial examination, the Q&A section and the review let me have the enough time to arrange my review process for the course.
